item.title: Life of a plant
item.description: We have a big pretty plant (of the Scindapsus pictus kind I think). One day, after spotting one of its leaves that had fallen off, I felt inspired to paint something plant-related. I found the combination of bright greens in younger leaves, the deep dark greens in mature ones, and the yellowish-brown colour of an occasional dead leaf interesting. Since I had three canvases, I decided to try to paint something resembling three stages of a plant’s life.

item.title: Mountains
item.description: The crackle paste strikes again in this one — this time only in the snow-mode, though. I had also discovered the masking tape at this point, hence the sharp edges in the mountain peaks.

item.title: Desert winter
item.description: I like textures in paintings and I recently got some crackle paste. In its usual dry state, the crackle paste looks kind of like a desert floor that hasn’t seen the rain in a very long time. I also realised I could make the paste into a different kind of texture if I poked it before it dried. This mode made me think of snow. I felt like combining the two thoughts and this little experimentation concluded with the creation of this painting.
